titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the W. A. Swanberg Papers

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion July 7, 2009

change.item: xml document instance created by Carrie Hintz

physdesc.extent: 36 linear ft. (81 boxes, 80 document boxes and 1 record storage carton).

repository.corpname: Columbia UniversityRare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Biographer and historian; author of books about Morgan Dix, Theodore Dreiser, Dorothy Elmhirst, James Fisk, William Randolph Hearst, Henry Luce, Joseph Pulitzer, Daniel E. Sickles, Willard D. Straight, Norman Thomas, Flora Payne Whitney, Williams C. Whitney, and the American Civil War. He won the Pulitzer Prize for biography in 1973 for "Luce and his Empire" and the National Book Award for biography in 1977 for "Norman Thomas: The Last Idealist." He also wrote many magazine articles on crime.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, notes, memoranda, notebooks, notecards, proofs, photographs, microfilms, and printed materials. The Papers include the manuscript research materials and correspondence for each of his books except his biography of Theodore Dreiser. Among the correspondents are William Benton, Bruce Catton, Carey McWilliams, Mrs. Fremont Older, and Thornton Wilder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Material is arranged into four series:
Series I: Cataloged Correspondence
Series II: Uncataloged Correspondence
Series III: Manuscripts and Project Files
Subseries III.1: Articles and Short Stories
Subseries III.2 Books
Subseries III.3: Unpublished Book Materials [RESTRICTED]
Subseries III.4: Manuscripts by Others
Series IV: Subject Files

p.emph: Boxes 69-78 are closed to all use.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 09/09/93 M-93-09-09 Papers Swanberg, John W. & Sara V. Gift

custodhist.p: Gift of John W. Swanberg & Sara V. Swanberg, 1993.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Collection Name]. Rare Book and Manuscript Library. Columbia University.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Materials relating to Theodore Dreiser are at The University of Pennsylvania Library.
